instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00430 - 12v line problems
threads.message:
The board only turns on the first LED. The others don't light up, not even when I try to turn them on.

As there is no schematic for this board, I am a little confused.

I have 12.1v on PP12v_G3H.
FET_EN_P12v_s5 was 15v, replaces the U6970, now I have 11.2v. The U6970 I removed from another board.

any suggestion?

threads.title: 820-00430 - 12v line problems
threads.message:
"FET_EN_P12v_s5 was 15v"
It should be 22V; Vgs=10V required.

If 12V_S5 is stable, try changing 12V_S0 MOSFET.

threads.title: 820-00430 - 12v line problems
threads.message:
I'm a bit confused without the correct schematic.

I changed the Mosfet, but I don't know if it's S5 or S0. I'm using the 00034 scheme. The site shows 2 mosfets, the board has only one.

threads.title: 820-00430 - 12v line problems
threads.message:
In the mentioned schematic, Q8450 is 12V_S0 MOSFET.
Q6970 is 12V_S5 MOSFET.

Did you remove CMOS battery?

threads.title: 820-00430 - 12v line problems
threads.message:
Yes, I removed the battery.

In the schematic, I found the S0 and S5 mosfets. But on the board, no.
It is very different from the scheme. Where there are two mosfets in the schematic, the board has only one mosfet.
